title: Call_Me_Guru
author: Call_Me_Guru
content: Newbies should learn from this fast confirmed transactions tricksMy message today may not freak the senior gurus here but has turned me to a mini celebrity in my office and locality. Bitcoin transactions got many people frustrated for two weeks and counting, some transactions do not know the time they will get confirmed as I write. But I get my transaction confirmed everyday since I know about ViaBTC.What you don't know, you don't know and what you think is no more a secret to a community is a cherished secret elsewhere. ViaBTC was never known to me or people around me, this is until many of us were complaining to my hearing, two transactions of mine were stuck too, but fortunately I got to know ViaBTC via online search. It was a stressful search and many that I tested did not work until I finally got it right. The people I recommended it for has been thanking me, so I thought I should let newbie and novice that are in my shoes to know this.https://ibb.co/16rrYGQThe requirement is simple, just go to https://www.viabtc.com/tools/txaccelerator and paste your transaction ID at the requested place and click on Free Submission or Paid Service depending on what you want. The difference is that the paid service can accelerate any transaction fee, but free submission will only accelerate the transaction provided the volume of a single transaction is ≤0.5 KB and the transaction fee rate is ≥ 0.0001 BTC/KB.Everybody I told that has been using 17sat/vb has been singing praise in less than 15 hours.

comments.author: JeromeTash
comments.body: It's not a secret, though. I personally used it early this week when the Bitcoin fee was up in the zone of 100 sats/vb. They have only 100 slots per hour and the transaction size has to be below 500 bytes if you are to use the free version.The paid version is probably more expensive than just bumping the transaction with a higher fee if it's RBF enabled.

comments.author: Upgrade00
comments.body: Paid transaction accelerator services usually charge more than it would take to prioritize the transaction and get it confirmed in no time, through the initial fee or by bumping it.ViaBTC is still effective for low weight transactions when transaction fees go really high and you can use it for free as long as the tx falls within the criteria. This is one reason to consolidate your smaller transactions when fees are cheaper so you can affordably transsct when the feerate rises.

comments.author: sheenshane
comments.body: Since ViaBTC is a mining pool, it has the ability to include transactions in the blocks that it mines by including the user's transaction in a block that is more likely to be mined quickly, the transaction is more likely to be confirmed faster than if the user had simply relied on the free market to determine the transaction fee.  But this doesn't guarantee that a transaction will be confirmed quickly, the speed at which a transaction is confirmed depends on a number of factors, including the size of the transaction fee and the current network congestion.But take note, if you're using below 10 sats you can't use this free service, they'll not rebroadcast below 10 sats based on my experience. Yes, I personally use this every time I have a transaction, and since it is free.

comments.body: Quote from: entebah on May 14, 2023, 02:00:16 AMthey will not rebroadcast your transaction and if you happen to use low fees then just increase the transaction to this fee rate ≥ 0.0001 BTC/KB. if you do that maybe they will add your transaction in to the next 1/2 block if they get a block. I submitted the new TX ID several times, on different browsers, different IP addresses and different devices, but it refused to work. I kept getting the same error and gave up with a conclusion that maybe they don't recognize transactions that have been recently bumped (Something like, If you can bump the transaction, then you don't need to use our free service)Fortunately, over the night, the Bitcoin transaction fee rate lowered, and my transaction got confirmed.

comments.author: boyptc
comments.body: I've been using it for a long time even before this network problems that we're experiencing and they really are reliable. But not at all times that it will get you accelerated because sometimes there are transactions that have higher sizes and they can't do anything much about it.Usually, the main requirement is just to pay a fee of 10 sats/byte and above and those are the type of transactions they'll help you get confirmed. And then, it's always best to practice to check how much the recommended fees through websites like mempool so that you're aware if there's a traffic or none.

comments.body: Quote from: boyptc on May 16, 2023, 11:28:52 PMUsually, the main requirement is just to pay a fee of 10 sats/byte and above and those are the type of transactions they'll help you get confirmedNo, you are wrong, because if you were right, then my transaction of almost 3 weeks would have been confirmed now. If you are using the free service of ViaBTC, you might need a transaction of between 15-16sat/bytes and above before they can help you accelerate it for free. My transaction is still stuck and I'm unable to use their service because I used 10.13sat/vbyte for it, which makes it practical as they alerted me that the fee was too low.Unfortunately, I couldn't opt for their paid service to maintain my privacy as they were asking for some personal details which I will NEVER provide.
